[![cran version](http://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/recode)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=recode)

Another function to recode variables.




# Example

```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
requireNamespace("knitr")
```


Some example data

```{r example_data}
d <- data.frame(
  num = 1:5,
  ch = letters[1:5],
  fac = factor(LETTERS[1:5]),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
knitr::kable(d)
```

## Recoding with a vector

The recoding vector `fromto` is expected to have even number of elements. The value `fromto[i]` is replaced with `fromto[i+1]`:

```{r}
d %>%
  mutate(
    new_num = recode::recode(d$num, 1, 10, 5, 50)
  )
```







## Installation

```r
devtools::install_github("mbojan/recode")
```
